intro: Anomalosicyos macrocarpus, commonly known as the giant caltrop, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny, spherical fruit that resembles a caltrop, with four sharp, protruding seeds. The plant belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, though it is more closely related to the genus Sicyos. Its thick, fleshy stems and leaves are adapted to store water, enabling it to survive in drought conditions. The fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of food in certain regions.
